beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Finnish Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Finnish Gravel scored 61 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Finnish Gravel. Lahti, Paijanne Tavastia, Finland. 110 mi. Fast, flowing Finnish gravel through UNESCO Geopark terrain. Well-maintained gravel roads, lakeside routes, and Nordic ski paths create a high-speed experience rather than a technical challenge. The continuous undulations and steep kickers separate riders, but this is racing, not survival. Riders average 35 kph on the twisting ski path sections.
beats.text_on_screen: Finnish Gravel | Lahti, Paijanne Tavastia, Finland | 110 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Race Quality. 5 out of 5. World-class execution. Sets the standard. SBT GRVL team brings top-tier event production expertise. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Remote terrain. Self-sufficiency required. Racing through a UNESCO Global Geopark under 19 hours of June daylight creates unique adventure. Prestige. 4 out of 5. Finishing this one means something. Founded by F1 driver Valtteri Bottas and WorldTour pro Tiffany Cromwell in partnership with the SBT GRVL team. Experience. 4 out of 5. Genuinely unique. Hard to replicate. Community. 4 out of 5. Riders come for the race. Stay for the people. Strong inclusive culture with family-friendly 4-day festival. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Pro-level talent in the mix. 10% pro field including WorldTour names like Toms Skujins (inaugural winner), Greg Van Avermaet, Petr Vakoc, and Andre Greipel. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Helsinki-Vantaa Airport offers good international connections, with Lahti just 1 hour by train or bus. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. The 177km Midnight Sun Route earned elite-level respect.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: HEL - 1hr by train/bus to Lahti

Lodging: Book early in Lahti city center. Options include Scandic Lahti City, Solo Sokos Hotel, and Cumulus Lahti. Limited capacity for race weekend. Lake Paijanne accommodations offer scenic alternatives ~24km from station.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Nordic Experience. Yes if you want a unique Nordic cultural experience with world-class event production. Yes if you're an F1/Bottas fan. Skip if you're chasing big climbing or watching your budget. International travelers should weigh the high costs against the unique experience.
